newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norwegian shares down with Wall Street.
newsitem.headline: Norwegian shares down with Wall Street.

text.p: Norwegian shares fell on Friday in reaction to a weak opening at Wall Street following a warning on second-quarter results by computer-chip maker Intel Corp, dealers said.
The Total share index ended at 1,158.24 points, down 0.7 percent, in moderate turnover of 799 million crowns.
Turnover picked up following the release of Intel's profit warning. "Clearly, Intel steered developments," one dealer said.
Norsk Hydro, Norway's largest listed company, was the most traded share at 88 million crowns, falling 1.5 percent to 356 crowns.
A-class shares in Anglo-Norwegian construction and engineering group Kvaerner slipped 1.2 percent to 408 crowns in trade worth 43 million crowns.
Dealers were bearish in the short-term following a series of all-time highs on the bourse last week and this week.
"We expect a correction following the recent sharp rise of the Total index," one dealer said.
